Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Analysis: AI proposed adding exceptions for legal retention, automated backups, and internal work product. HR implemented a partial fix, adding exceptions for audit/compliance requirements and automatic backups, addressing the core of the AI's concern.
AI proposed reducing the agreement's term from the maximum acceptable three years to the preferred two years. HR implemented this exact change.

Issues Flagged by AI but Not Addressed b.Analysis: AI flagged that requiring written adherence from all representatives is impractical and violates Policy 2. HR did not address this, leaving a burdensome administrative obligation in place.
AI flagged the non-solicitation term as exceeding the 2-year maximum and failing to exempt portfolio companies, per Policy 4. HR did not amend this, leaving a significant compliance risk.
AI noted the clause lacks a mandatory waiver for indirect and consequential damages, a critical protection under Policy 1. HR did not address this high-risk issue.
AI flagged the absence of a mandatory clause to prevent unintended IP licensing, as required by Policy 1. HR did not add this protective language.

AI flagged the restriction on contacting suppliers and customers without an ordinary course of business exception, per Policy 6. HR did not amend this, potentially impacting normal business operations.
AI suggested deleting a superfluous clause waiving 'culpa in contrahendo' to improve clarity, per Policy 10. HR left the redundant clause in place.
AI noted the agreement improperly grants indemnification rights to 'the Company', a non-signatory, violating Policy 7. HR did not remove this, creating potential enforcement issues.
AI proposed changing the strict liability standard for representative breaches to a preferred 'best efforts' standard, per Policy 13. HR did not make this change.
AI noted the use of Austrian law instead of the preferred Belgian law, per Policy 11. HR accepted the fallback jurisdiction, which is permissible but not ideal.

High Priority.citation: ...each person to whom such disclosure in whatever mode is made shall adhere to the terms of this Confidentiality Agreement in writing as if he or she were a party thereto;
High Priority.problem: The clause requires burdensome written adherence letters from all representatives. The definition of permitted recipients is also narrower than preferred, omitting shareholders, potential syndicate members, and general employees.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Information may be disclosed by us to our affiliates and their respective directors, officers, employees, consultants, advisers, shareholders, potential syndicate members, agents, representatives, and other providers of financing (collectively, 'Representatives'), who need to know such information to evaluate the Company, provided we remain responsible for any breach of this Confidentiality Agreement by our Representatives.

High Priority.citation: ...all information or data received, including copies, will be immediately deleted or destroyed as soon as we decide not to proceed with the evaluation of the acquisition opportunity...
High Priority.problem: The agreement mandates absolute destruction of information upon termination, failing to provide required exceptions for retention on automated backup systems, for legal/regulatory compliance, or within internal work product.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Upon the written request of Deloitte FA and/or the Company, we shall return or destroy all Information. However, this obligation shall not apply to: (i) Information we or our Representatives must retain under applicable law, rule, or regulation; (ii) Information saved to electronic media under automatic archiving or data-security procedures; and (iii) reports, notes, or other materials prepared by or on behalf of us that incorporate Information ('Secondary Information'). Any material not returned or destroyed remains subject to this Confidentiality Agreement's confidentiality obligations.

High Priority.citation: we will not directly solicit the employment of any manager or employee of the Company.
High Priority.problem: The non-solicitation clause is subject to the agreement's general 3-year term (Section 12), which exceeds the 2-year maximum. It also fails to exempt our affiliated portfolio companies from the restriction.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: For a period of two (2) years from the date of this Confidentiality Agreement, we agree not to directly solicit for employment any employee of the Company with whom we had material contact in connection with the evaluation of the Company. This restriction shall not apply to any of our affiliated portfolio companies, nor to employees who respond to public advertisements, make unsolicited applications, are referred by an unaffiliated recruiter, or whose employment commences more than six (6) months after the date of this Confidentiality Agreement.

High Priority.citation: ...we will be held liable for any breach... and we will hold harmless the Company and Deloitte FA from and against any claims, damages, losses, costs or expenses...
High Priority.problem: The liability clause is unlimited and does not exclude indirect, consequential, special, or punitive damages, which is a prohibited obligation under the playbook.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Liability for a breach of this Confidentiality Agreement shall be limited to proven, direct damages. In no event shall either party be liable for any indirect, consequential, special, punitive, or incidental damages, or for any loss of profits, revenue, or data.

High Priority.problem: The agreement is missing a clause to explicitly state that no intellectual property rights are being transferred or licensed. This is a mandatory inclusion to prevent unintended IP transfers.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: No provision in this Confidentiality Agreement shall be construed as granting any license or rights, by implication, estoppel, or otherwise, to any intellectual property of either party.

Medium Priority.citation: ...we will not directly or indirectly contact the shareholders, the management, the employees, the suppliers, the creditors and the customers of the Company...
Medium Priority.problem: The no-contact provision is overly broad, restricting contact with suppliers, creditors, and customers. It also lacks a necessary exception for contacts made in the ordinary course of business.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Without the prior written consent of Deloitte FA, we agree not to contact any directors, officers, or employees of the Company in connection with the purpose of evaluating the Company. This restriction shall not be breached by contact made for another purpose than evaluating or negotiating the proposed transaction.

Medium Priority.citation: ...we explicitly waive any right to claim for damages based on culpa in contrahendo (or any similar legal grounds);
Medium Priority.problem: This clause, and its repetition in the addendum, is a redundant legal acknowledgement that restates a specific legal doctrine ('culpa in contrahendo'). Such clauses add unnecessary clutter to the agreement and should be removed.

Medium Priority.citation: ...we will hold harmless the Company and Deloitte FA from and against any claims, damages, losses, costs or expenses...
Medium Priority.problem: This clause grants enforceable rights (indemnification) to 'the Company', which is not a signatory to the agreement. The NDA must not grant enforceable rights to non-signatories.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: The reference to holding 'the Company' harmless should be removed to eliminate third-party beneficiary rights. The clause should only apply to the signatory, Deloitte FA.

Low Priority.citation: we will be held liable for any breach of this Confidentiality Agreement by ourselves, our employees and any third party to which we have disclosed any Information...
Low Priority.problem: The agreement imposes strict liability for any breach by our representatives. The preferred standard is an efforts-based obligation to procure compliance.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: We will use our best efforts to procure that each of our Representatives who receives any Information is aware of and adheres to the terms of this Confidentiality Agreement. We shall be responsible for any breach of the confidentiality obligations of this Confidentiality Agreement by our Representatives.

Low Priority.citation: The provisions of this Confidentiality Agreement shall terminate three years from that date of this Confidentiality Agreement...
Low Priority.problem: The confidentiality term is three years. While this is the maximum acceptable duration, the preferred term is two years.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: The obligations of confidentiality set out in this letter shall continue in full force and effect for a period of two (2) years from the date of this Confidentiality Agreement.

Low Priority.citation: this Confidentiality Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with substantive Austrian law. We agree that the commercial court of Vienna, Austria, shall have exclusive jurisdiction...
Low Priority.problem: The governing law and jurisdiction are Austrian. While this is an acceptable European fallback, it deviates from the primary preference for Belgian law and the courts of Antwerp.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: This Confidentiality Agreement, and any contractual or non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Belgium. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Confidentiality Agreement shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts in Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 3
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...destruction of the information or data. ++[However, we shall be required to keep one (1) copy of the Information (i) pursuant to audit or compliance requirements or (ii) that has been saved under automatic archiving or electronic back-up procedures]{.mark}.++'
hr_edits_data.problem: The original clause mandated absolute destruction of information upon termination, which violates High Priority Policy 3. The HR representative correctly added language to permit retention for compliance and automatic backup procedures, bringing the clause into alignment with the playbook's requirements. The added language successfully addresses the most critical aspects of the policy.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 12
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '...shall terminate --three-- years from that date of this Confidentiality Agreement...' New: '...shall terminate ++[two]{.mark}++ years from that date of this Confidentiality Agreement...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The original confidentiality term was three years. The HR representative changed it to two years. While a three-year term is the maximum acceptable under Low Priority Policy 12, the playbook's preferred term is two years. This change is a positive alignment with the playbook's preference.
